page.title: 01Area of Stable Fitzpaine
page.content: Staple Fitzpaine is the village in the centre of this agricultural area. The population is very small and those that live here tend to be living off the land and live in tythed cottages or farms. The Portman family still live at the Manor House. The Portman Alms houses we restored in 1970. A new centre for the elderly to live in called 'Ladyacre' has been opened by the council. School closed 14 years ago. Nearby Taunton and Pickerage Golf Club. A private club and 600 members. Established 1892. It has a tree planting scheme. West hatch acre - Farmers Arms public house with new nightclub/disco 'Raffles'. Also animal rescue centre opened by RSPCA in 1963. Open daily for wildlife casualties and stray domestic animals. Village of Curland nestled around Meth Chapel. Post office & riding stables.
